channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 斋月是穆斯林历法中最神圣的月份，有些国家的斋月从星期一开始，而有些国家则从星期二开始。这怎么可能呢？以下是各地差异如此之大的原因。
item.description:
Ramadan, the holiest month of the Muslim calendar, starts on Monday in some countries but on Tuesday in others. How is that possible?

Here’s why there’s so much variation from place to place. https://t.co/Mmg613p6Qq

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 凯瑟琳王妃周一为编辑一张全家福照片道歉。"她在社交媒体上写道："和许多业余摄影师一样，我偶尔也会尝试剪辑。
item.description:
Princess Catherine apologized on Monday for editing a family photo. “Like many amateur photographers, I do occasionally experiment with editing,” she wrote on social media. https://t.co/8B546Vicsk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 纪录片《马里乌波尔 20 天》为乌克兰赢得了首个奥斯卡奖。但它所描绘的这座在战争初期象征着抵抗的城市，正在被莫斯科按照俄罗斯的形象重新塑造。
item.description:
The documentary “20 Days in Mariupol” has won Ukraine’s first-even Oscar. But the city it portrays, a symbol of resistance in th early days of the war, is being remade by Moscow in Russia’s image. https://t.co/5d46LcrMMd

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 据 @marklandler 报道，一张旨在平息人们对威尔士王妃健康状况猜测的母亲节照片却适得其反--有可能破坏人们对王室的信任。
item.description:
A Mother’s Day photo intended to douse speculation about the Princess of Wales’ health did the opposite — and threatened to undermine trust in the royal family, reports @marklandler https://t.co/njTUTDBXjN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 威尔士王妃凯瑟琳为修整一张全家福照片道歉。几家新闻机构在确定照片经过处理后，撤下了这张照片。
item.description:
Catalina, Princesa de Gales, se disculpó por retocar una fotografía familiar. Varias agencias de noticias retiraron la imagen tras determinar que había sido manipulada. https://t.co/0s9ZW1ChQc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 德国一家法院周一宣判一名美国男子有罪，他在德国最著名的旅游胜地之一新天鹅堡附近强奸并谋杀了一名妇女，并企图谋杀她的同伴。
item.description:
A German court on Monday convicted an American man of raping and murdering a woman and attempting to murder her companion near the Neuschwanstein Castle, one of the country’s most famous tourist destinations. https://t.co/paPQyQnSoK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰导演姆斯蒂斯拉夫-切尔诺夫（Mstyslav Chernov）凭借《马里乌波尔的 20 天》于周日获得奥斯卡最佳纪录片奖，他在获奖感言中动情地谴责了俄罗斯军队对乌克兰的持续入侵。
item.description:
Mstyslav Chernov, a Ukrainian director, used his acceptance speech for “20 Days in Mariupol,” which won the Oscar for best documentary feature on Sunday, to give an emotional denunciation of the continued invasion of his country by Russian forces. https://t.co/hxRRyUyJq5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 在哥伦比亚的阿拉卡塔卡镇，走在任何一条街道上，都不可能不看到与曾在这里生活过的最著名人物有关的典故：1982 年诺贝尔文学奖得主加布里埃尔-加西亚-马尔克斯（Gabriel García Márquez）。
item.description:
En la ciudad colombiana de Aracataca es imposible caminar por alguna calle sin ver alusiones a la persona más famosa que la habitó: el ganador del Premio Nobel de Literatura de 1982, Gabriel García Márquez. https://t.co/piGqcjg1ob

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 当地警方周一表示，在瑞士阿尔卑斯山发现了五名失踪滑雪者的尸体，目前正在搜寻他们队伍中的第六名成员。
item.description:
Five missing skiers were found dead in the Swiss Alps and the search was ongoing for a sixth member of their group, the local police said on Monday. https://t.co/q8WAl80NkT

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰最快将于 7 月派遣 F-16 战斗机参战，但它将只有大约几架。获得这些战机并培训乌克兰飞行员使用它们是一项艰巨而复杂的挑战。
item.description:
Ukraine could send F-16 fighter jets into combat as soon as July, but it will have only about a handful. Getting them, and training Ukrainian pilots to use them, has been a tough, complex challenge. https://t.co/vPPLwcPZV2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：威尔士王妃凯瑟琳为一张全家福照片被篡改一事道歉。多家新闻机构在确定照片被篡改后撤回了照片。
item.description:
Breaking News: Catherine, Princess of Wales, apologized for the doctoring of a family photo. Several news agencies withdrew the image after they determined it had been manipulated. https://t.co/av11Na6bVS

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 斋月通常是宗教虔诚、从早到晚斋戒、慈善、家庭聚会和夜宴的日子。一位妇女说："即使没有斋月，我们也要斋戒。但人们正在尽其所能地遵守斋戒。
item.description:
Ramadan is usually a time of religious devotion, dawn-to-dusk fasting, charity, family gatherings and nightly feasts. All that seems far away in Gaza.

“Even without Ramadan, we are fasting,” one woman said. But people are doing what they can to observe. https://t.co/VwjlMfTmlw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 肯辛顿宫发布了一张威尔士王妃凯瑟琳的照片，旨在展示她手术后的恢复情况，但多家新闻机构建议新闻机构撤下这张照片，称这张照片经过了篡改。
item.description:
A photo of Catherine, Princess of Wales, released by Kensington Palace and meant to showcase her recovery from surgery, has come under scrutiny after multiple news agencies advised news organizations to withdraw it, saying the image had been manipulated. https://t.co/iKt61kCWkp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 奥斯卡颁奖典礼的悼念环节以《纳瓦尔尼》（Navalny）中阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的片段开场，该纪录片于 2022 年获得奥斯卡奖，讲述了上个月在俄罗斯监狱中去世的俄罗斯反对派领导人的故事。
item.description:
The in memoriam segment at the Academy Awards opened with a clip of Aleksei Navalny from “Navalny,” the Oscar-winning 2022 documentary about the Russian opposition leader who died last month in a Russian prison. https://t.co/WeZtxvtxK7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 拉塔姆航空公司一架飞往新西兰的客机因 "技术问题 "导致 "强烈晃动"，机上数十人受伤。大多数人伤势较轻，但有一人伤势严重。
item.description:
Dozens of people on a Latam Airlines plane headed to New Zealand were injured after what the airline described as a “strong movement” caused by a “technical problem.” Most injuries were minor, but one person was in serious condition. https://t.co/CUocdDi8uZ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 葡萄牙社会党周日晚在一场激烈的全国大选中认输，这场选举结束了该党长达八年的执政生涯，反映出葡萄牙的右倾化趋势。
item.description:
Portugal’s Socialist Party conceded defeat on Sunday night in a very tight national election that ended the party’s eight years in power and reflected the country’s drift to the right, which follows a broader trend in Europe. https://t.co/TRESai5dab

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 11, 2024

item.title: 受到伦敦西北部米凯拉中学等学校成功学业的启发，一些校长开始对学生的行为进行严格控制。
item.description:
Inspired by the academic success of schools like the Michaela secondary school in northwest London, some principals are introducing tight controls on students’ behavior. https://t.co/YWyGrJvhag

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 在英国，新开了一大波出售纽约式百吉饼的店铺，与伦敦的同类产品相比，纽约式百吉饼更大、更硬、更有风味。但是，一些传统主义者仍然坚持伦敦的 "贝果"。
item.description:
There’s a wave of new shops in Britain selling New York-style bagels, distinct for being bigger, doughier and more heavily seasoned than their London counterparts. But some traditionalists are standing by the London “beigel.” https://t.co/pJfmtwUUHY

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 在酷热难耐的哥伦比亚山城阿拉卡塔卡，走在大街小巷，你不可能不看到与这里最著名的前居民--1982 年诺贝尔文学奖得主加布里埃尔-加西亚-马尔克斯--有关的典故。
item.description:
In the sweltering Colombian mountain town of Aracataca, it is impossible to walk down a single street without seeing allusions to its most renowned former resident: the winner of the 1982 Nobel Prize in Literature, Gabriel García Márquez. https://t.co/OpQbP5tEH7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 随着乌克兰奋力抵抗俄罗斯的猛烈进攻，损失不断增加，应征入伍的妇女人数激增，越来越多的妇女自愿参加战斗。
item.description:
As Ukraine struggles against fierce Russian assaults and its losses mount, there has been a surge of women who have enlisted, and they are increasingly volunteering for combat roles. https://t.co/cQwSTGYJ0s

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 在接受腹部手术近两个月后，威尔士王妃凯瑟琳出现在一张官方照片上，庆祝英国的母亲节。
item.description:
Nearly two months after undergoing abdominal surgery, Catherine, the princess of Wales, appeared in an official photograph, marking Mother’s Day in Britain. https://t.co/2HCO1i6ESv

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，中国的独生子女政策一直贯穿于日常生活的方方面面。现在，面对人口的萎缩和老龄化，中国政府正在利用许多相同的宣传渠道传递相反的信息：多生孩子。
item.description:
For decades, China's one-child policy was woven into the fabric of everyday life.

Now, faced with a shrinking and aging population, the government is using many of the same propaganda channels to send the opposite message: Have more babies. https://t.co/jYn7fLkGJ5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 随着亚马逊地区各国与极端天气引发的创纪录数量的火灾作斗争，数百平方英里的亚马逊雨林被烧毁。
item.description:
Hundreds of square miles of the Amazon rainforest have burned as countries in the region battle a record number of fires fueled by extreme weather. https://t.co/Vmz81XYV3j

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 反对改革的投票结果给了希望轻松获胜的政府当头一棒。但这一结果并不一定反映出选民转向更加保守。
item.description:
The vote against the changes dealt a blow to a government that had hoped for an easy victory. But the outcome does not necessarily reflect a turn toward a more conservative electorate. https://t.co/dBymgExQzS

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 照片记录了帮派暴力如何使海地陷入最严重的混乱时期。
item.description:
Photographs document how gang violence has plunged Haiti into one of its worst periods of chaos. https://t.co/Kwm2wN0YxT

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 葡萄牙将于周日举行大选。以下是需要了解的信息。
item.description:
Portugal is holding a general election on Sunday. Here’s what to know. https://t.co/MkufRdTMNs

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 爱尔兰选民否决了对该国宪法的两项修改提案，这两项提案将删除有关妇女在家庭中职责的措辞，并扩大婚姻之外的家庭定义。
item.description:
Voters in Ireland rejected two proposed changes to the country’s Constitution that would have removed language about women’s duties being in the home and broadened the definition of family beyond marriage. https://t.co/jsn0dKxyQK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 斯里兰卡人对一项新法律--《在线安全法》表示担忧，该法赋予政府广泛的权力，可将社交媒体上的言论视为 "禁止言论"。
item.description:
Sri Lankans are concerned about a new law, the Online Safety Act, that gives the government wide-ranging powers to deem speech on social media to be “prohibited statements.” https://t.co/bZUFVGU2XM

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 教皇说乌克兰应该有 "白旗的勇气"，梵蒂冈发言人说这意味着 "停火和谈判"。但教皇的话引起了人们的疑问，即他是否在建议乌克兰投降。
item.description:
The pope said Ukraine should have the “courage of the white flag,” which a Vatican spokesman said meant “cease-fire and negotiation.” But the pope’s words have raised questions about whether he was suggesting that Ukraine surrender. https://t.co/OqcIwWTvXk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 美国总统拜登周六就加沙地带平民死亡人数不断上升的问题斥责了以色列总理本雅明-内塔尼亚胡，同时重申了美国对这个长期盟友的支持。
item.description:
President Biden rebuked Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Saturday over the rising civilian death toll in the Gaza Strip, even as he reaffirmed American support for a longtime ally. https://t.co/fe6I9XvZ0e

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024
